questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'break' statement in a loop?
choices: To skip the rest of the loop and move to the next iteration.
To terminate the loop and move to the next statement after the loop.
To continue to the next iteration of the loop.
To pause the loop execution temporarily.
To restart the loop from the beginning.
To print the current loop index.

questions.question: Which of the following languages is not a statically-typed language?
choices: Java
Python
C#
Swift

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'finally' block in a try-catch-finally statement?
choices: To catch and handle exceptions.
To define code that will always be executed, whether an exception is thrown or not.
To specify conditions under which an exception should be caught.
To ensure that the catch block is always executed.
To create a loop that repeats until a certain condition is met.

questions.question: In object-oriented programming, what is polymorphism?
choices: The ability of an object to take on multiple forms.
The process of encapsulating data and methods within a class.
The concept of hiding the internal implementation of an object.
The practice of writing a function in multiple programming languages.
The technique of breaking a program into smaller, manageable parts.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dynamically-typed programming language?
choices: C
Java
Python
Swift
